Articles.Content:
With the KSP2 scatter now being collideable and potentially 'getting in the way' could they include a feature to clear scatter from a given area?

Effectively clearing ground to make simple runways etc, so not 'terraforming' or laying tarmac (which wouid be nice though), just shifting the rocks out of the way.

I expect the runways and such be lifted slightly above the ground like on the picture here  in any case, I think that dealing with ground is part of the gameplay, you wouldn't want to build your base in a forest, would you? Looking for a good place sounds fun and is a bit of challenge. And even if you would, I believe we will get some structures to deal with the terrain (like we saw at the end of the trailer)

Looking for a good place sounds fun and is a bit of challenge. And even if you would, I believe we will get some structures to deal with the terrain (like we saw at the end of the trailer)

I do agree with you here, dealing with the terrain and finding decent landing spots is a good gameplay aspect.  Constructed runways etc would be stuck on top of the terrain, as they are now.

I was thinking of a simple way to create a very basic 'safer' landing area etc, without altering the actual terrain at all, just shove the rocks out of the way.  So for a runway you would still need  to find a flatish area,  Larger rocks or trees etc should probably require appopriate tools or equipnent, so there would need to be limits to what can be cleared by hand, so selecting a suitable location is still crucial.
